definition: to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
old variant of 攜|携[xie2]
old variant of 攜|携[xie2]
to carry/to take along/to bring along/to hold (hands)/also pr. [xi1]

sentences.english: If the jade advisers and assists in everywhere she, and be ambitioning to talk a few lines for her in madam's in front.
sentences.chinese: 如玉处处提携她，而且在夫人面前肯为她说几句话。

sentences.english: It is through our consecration that we are able to find her hand in the midst of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 透过我们的奉献，才能让我们在黑暗中找到她的提携。

sentences.english: Radiographic assessment of osteoarthritic changes and the carrying angle was also performed.
sentences.chinese: 通过X线对骨性关节炎的变化和提携角进行评估。

sentences.english: The boss might give you a brawlotion, but don't hold your breath.
sentences.chinese: 老板可能要提携你，但别太殷切期望。

sentences.english: We don't want to advance the younger employee in prejudice of the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 我们不愿意提携较年纪轻的职员而有损于较年长者。

definition: to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to help/to assist financially
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
to recommend sb/to give a referral
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
nobility/person of high rank
to help one another/to come to sb's help
to point out/to indicate/to give directions/to show how (to do sth)/to censure/to pick at
Bo Le (horse connoisseur during Spring and Autumn Period)/a good judge of talent/talent scout
to recommend
to give instructions/to give advice
